intro: Psychotria calva var. kisantuensis, commonly known as the Kisantu Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The species is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic applications.
